fdd:FDD.titleName: Expert Witness Disk Image, EnCase L01 Logical

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:fullName: Expert Witness Compression Format, EnCase L01 Logical

fdd:description.p: First version of the EWF logical evidence file image format from Guidance Software (EnCase brand), generally similar to the description offered in EWF_Family. This and the counterpart EWF_E01 format offer three levels of compression: "no," "good," and "best."
EWF_L01 files contain 13 sections; the first four are carried over from EWF_SMART; the next nine are shared with EWF_E01; and the final two are new additions:

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: First version of the EWF logical evidence file image format from Guidance Software (EnCase brand), generally similar to the description offered in EWF_Family.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:productionPhase: Typically used for data analysis and not part of a process to create new content. May be used to archive data.

fdd:relatedTo.fdd:titleName: Expert Witness Format, Encase Lx01 Logical

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:disclosure: Open documentation produced via reverse engineering by Joachim Metz.

fdd:documentation.a: EWF specification: Expert Witness Compression Format specification

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:adoption: In archives (as distinct from legal and law enforcement settings), where tools like Bit Curator and FTK Imager are in wide use, user comments suggest that bitstream formats like EWF_E01 and AFF (description forthcoming) are more widely used than logical formats like EWF_L01.

fdd:filenameExtension.fdd:note: Filename extensions for the first 99 content segments are .L01, .L02, through .L99; followed by .LAA, .LAB, and so on.

fdd:magicNumbers.fdd:note: From Gary Kessler's File Signatures Table.

fdd:general.p: Joachim Metz's analysis highlights the details of this format, including variation in the structure of .L01 headers, in part depending on the version of the EnCase tool used to create the file (pp. 5-15, esp. p. 8-9 and 15), and variations in the volume section according to the creating application (pp. 18-20).

fdd:urlReference.tag: EWF specification: Expert Witness Compression Format specification
fdd:urlReference.comment: Joachim Metz's reverse-engineered documentation of EWF subtypes including EWF_L01.
Free tool from AccessData, also the source for the more extensive FTK Toolkit.
Tool to support digital content management, including work with disk images and forensic analysis.
Information in PRONOM from UK National Archives about Logical File Evidence Format. PUID: fmt/804.
